conclusion: Understand the relationship between V and T using the ideal gas law.
At state A: Pressure p_A = p_0, Temperature T_A = T_0, Volume V_A = V_0.
From the ideal gas law at state A: p_0 V_0 = n R T_0.
At state B: Volume V_B = 2V_0, Temperature T_B is unknown, Pressure p_B = p_0.
Using the ideal gas law at state B: T_B = 2T_0.
At state C: Volume V_C = V_0, Temperature T_C is unknown.
The extension line of BC passes through the origin, indicating a linear relationship.
Determine the equation of the line BC: V = (V_0/T_0) T.
Use the equation of BC to find T_C: T_C = T_0.
The temperature at state C is T_C = T_0.
